article.headline: Texas A&M-Corpus Christi 75, Howard 57
article.story: CORPUS CHRISTI, Texas (AP) -- Chris Daniels scored 14 points and grabbed a team-high nine rebounds to lead Texas A&M-Corpus Christi to a 75-57 win over Howard on Friday night in the Flint Hills Resources Islander Classic. Cedric Smith came off the bench to score a team-high 16 points in 23 minutes. Josh Washington scored 11 and Josh Ervin added 10 for the Islanders (7-4). Darryl Hudson scored 15 points and Darek Mitchell added 13 to lead Howard (5-8). Jason Trotter grabbed a game-high 10 boards, including four offensive rebounds. Texas A&M-Corpus Christi outscored Howard 50-14 in the paint. The Islanders also enjoyed an advantage on the boards, outrebounding the Bison 40-29. Howard shot 26 percent in the first half as the Islanders built a 17-point lead. The Bison made 33 percent of their field goals overall, while the Islanders shot 53 percent from the field.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
